body: How can I train on voc dataset? I just attemp to transfer voc format to coco in the code，but the map is much lower than code.

> How can I train on voc dataset? I just attemp to transfer voc format to coco in the code，but the map is much lower than code.

my mAP is also low about 62.(don't use mutil_training, )

> 
> 
> > How can I train on voc dataset? I just attemp to transfer voc format to coco in the code，but the map is much lower than code.
> 
> my mAP is also low about 62.(don't use mutil_training, )

How about your epoch and batchsize? What is your training process on voc ? Did you download coco API in this code ? I just put voc into the code withing no modifying. My epoch and batchsize are 88 and 2 , but the map is around 40 , is there anything wrong ?

issue.title: training on voc dataset

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
I've trained voc with batch size equals 2 and epoch equals 88. In 88th epoch ,the map is just around 0.4. It's much lower than the code. It's the reason that batch size and epoch are too small?? 

Also, I want to know if I can use darknet-21 and add extral layers to train voc from scratch. (Because I want to modify the backbone just for paper)

body:
> 
> 
>     * i will give train and val dataset type as darknet
> 
>     * i have eval_tools with voc which proved useful

What's the eval tools?

> > ```
> > * i will give train and val dataset type as darknet
> > 
> > * i have eval_tools with voc which proved useful
> > ```
> 
> What's the eval tools?
faster rcnn eval for pascal voc

> > > How can I train on voc dataset? I just attemp to transfer voc format to coco in the code，but the map is much lower than code.
> > 
> > 
> > my mAP is also low about 62.(don't use mutil_training, )
> 
> How about your epoch and batchsize? What is your training process on voc ? Did you download coco API in this code ? I just put voc into the code withing no modifying. My epoch and batchsize are 88 and 2 , but the map is around 40 , is there anything wrong ?

1、my epoch is 50, 
2、batchsize is 8 for 2080ti （only  use one gpu）
3、process no change , is same as the yolov3
4、mAP is 62%
Are you using Yolo 3. weights for transfer learning or training from scratch?

issue.title: train on VOC data

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body: Have you train on VOC data?

body:
@Peterisfar
Is your mAP generated by running train.py or test.py?

What's your training datasets? voc2007+2012 or voc2012?
And what's your test datasets?

100 epoch, 64% mAP here.
Train on VOC07+12 trainval, test on VOC 07.
BTW, I use the Adam optimizer, and remove the weight decay of the backbone.

> 100 epoch, 64% mAP here.
> Train on VOC07+12 trainval, test on VOC 07.
> BTW, I use the Adam optimizer, and remove the weight decay of the backbone.

Similar with you, 40epoch, 65% mAP, also training on VOC07+12 and test on VOC07. I use SGD. But I have used other's yolov3 project and get 78%+ mAP ? Is there any fault of the code ?

> 100 epoch, 64% mAP here.
> Train on VOC07+12 trainval, test on VOC 07.
> BTW, I use the Adam optimizer, and remove the weight decay of the backbone.

I use the origin code. Now I try to train 100 epoch, and see the tensorboard.

> Are you using Yolo 3. weights for transfer learning or training from scratch?
pre-trained weight is  darknet.conv.75

> .
first, i think the loss is different from version keras(same as darknet), for example, loss should to calculate max iou in loss_conf；
second, i think the anchor label is different from others, for example, a GT should calculate ious with 9 anchors, select the max.
i change these codes, and mAP now is 71%.

> @Peterisfar
> Is your mAP generated by running train.py or test.py?

no, i use voc eval tool
